[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [No Bounds Checking] Loop variable i and reserve indices have no bounds validation - can i-1 underflow or access out-of-bounds reserves causing panic or data corruption? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: update_navi_position_value()] [No Event Emission] Function doesn't emit any events - can attacker manipulate values without any on-chain record, making forensics impossible after exploit? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [No Debugging] Function has no intermediate value logging - if position value is calculated incorrectly, how can operators debug which reserve or calculation step failed? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Gas Griefing] Attacker can create positions in all reserves to maximize loop iterations at line 43 - can this cause update_navi_position_value() to exceed block gas limit? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Inefficient Loop] Loop checks supply==0 && borrow==0 at line 58 after expensive operations (lines 44-56) - can reordering checks reduce gas cost and attack surface? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Cross-Asset Risk] Function values all reserves in same account together - if one reserve is compromised or has exploit, does it contaminate valuation of all other reserves in same position? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Asset Correlation] Function treats all assets independently - if multiple correlated assets (e.g., stablecoins) depeg simultaneously, can total value calculation be incorrect due to oracle lag? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: update_navi_position_value()] [Generic Type Constraint] PrincipalCoinType has no trait bounds (line 13) - can caller instantiate with non-coin type to bypass type safety checks in vault operations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [U256 Semantics] All calculations use u256 (lines 36, 39, 40, 65, 66) - if values should be signed (e.g., net PnL), can overflow produce positive value when actual position is negative? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Zero Supply Positive Borrow] If total_supply_usd_value is 0 but total_borrow_usd_value is positive at line 74, function returns 0 - can this hide debt and allow vault to operate with negative net value? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [All Reserves Skipped] If all reserves have supply==0 && borrow==0 (line 58), loop never accumulates values - does returning 0 at line 78 correctly represent empty position vs error state? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Partial Reserve Failure] If some reserves fail to price (oracle error) but others succeed, does function panic and lose all progress or can it partially succeed with incorrect total? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Ray Math Vulnerability] If ray_math::ray_mul() at lines 53-54 has rounding bug favoring supply over borrow, can attacker exploit this to artificially inflate net position value? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Dynamic Calculator Trust] Function trusts dynamic_calculator::calculate_current_index() at line 48 - if calculator has bug or is exploitable, can it return manipulated indices that inflate/deflate positions? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Vault Utils Dependency] vault_utils::mul_with_oracle_price() is critical for valuation at lines 65-66 - if this function has precision bug, does it propagate to all Navi position valuations? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [TODO Production Risk] Line 46-47 has TODO comment about index selection - is current dynamic index choice production-ready or placeholder that could be incorrect for actual Navi protocol? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Module: volo_vault::navi_adaptor] [Missing Documentation] No module-level documentation - are there unstated assumptions about when/how to call these functions that could lead to misuse? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Exact Zero Comparison] Line 58 checks supply==0 and borrow==0 - if values are dust amounts (e.g., 1 wei), are they included in valuation and does this cause precision issues? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Comparison Order] Line 74 checks total_supply_usd_value < total_borrow_usd_value - if values are equal (position exactly break-even), is returning positive net value correct? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Reverse Iteration] Loop counts DOWN from reserves_count to 1 (lines 43, 59, 71) - is there semantic meaning to this order or can forward iteration introduce different results due to state changes? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/navi_adaptor.move] [Function: calculate_navi_position_value()] [Index Offset] Using i-1 for asset_id (lines 44, 51, 56) when i starts at reserves_count - if reserves are 1-indexed in Navi, does this skip the last reserve? (High)
